metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9799 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient bounds checking of data during inter-process communication might allow a compromised content process to be able to read memory from the parent process under certain conditions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
